intro: Maytenus dasyclados, commonly known as the Brazilian mayten, is a small to medium-sized tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by small, round berries that turn red when mature. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types and showing some degree of drought tolerance.
